hours_text:
# 2026 Hours

# 2026 Hours

## Visit Us

### The Manor:

  * **January 1 – February 6**
    * Closed to the public
  * **February 7 – March 27**
    * Open Saturday and Sunday 12 – 3 PM
    * The Manor will occasionally close early for special events. (Closed February 28, and March 15)
  * **March 28 – October 12**
    * Monday: Closed (except most Monday holidays)
    * Tuesday – Sunday: 11 AM – 3 PM
    * The Manor will occasionally close early for special events.
  * **October 13 – November 23 – Closed**
  * **November 24 – January 3, 2027**
    * Monday: Closed (except most Monday holidays)
    * Tuesday – Sunday: 11 AM – 7 PM
    * The Manor will occasionally close early for special events.

### Gardens and Grounds:

  * **January 1 – February 6**
    * Closed to the public
  * **February 7 – March 27**
    * Monday – Fridays: The Gardens and Grounds are closed to the public
    * Saturday and Sunday: 12 – 3 PM
  * **March 28 – May 2**
    * Mondays: The Gardens and Grounds are closed to the public
    * Tuesday – Sunday: 10 AM to 4 PM
  * **May 3 – October 12**
    * Mondays: The Gardens and Grounds are closed to the public
    * Tuesday – Saturday: 10 AM – 4 PM
    * Sunday: 10 AM – 3 PM
  * **October 13 – November 23**
    * Monday – Friday: The Gardens and Grounds are closed to the public
    * Saturday and Sunday: 10 AM – 4 PM
  * **November 24 – January 3, 2027**
    * Monday: Closed (except most Monday holidays)
    * Tuesday – Sunday: 11 AM – 7 PM

admission_text:
# Buy General Admission Tickets

# Buy General Admission Tickets

## Click the button below to buy general admission tickets!

[Buy Tickets](https://blithewold-mansion-gardens-arboretum.square.site/s/shop)

* * *

**What is included with general admission?**  
With general admission, you can tour the Manor and grounds. It does NOT include programming, like Sparkle, Afternoon Teas, outdoor concerts, etc.

**If I buy my tickets online, will I receive physical tickets?**  
No. You will be e-mailed a confirmation that you can print out or bring up on your phone.

**When is the last admission?**  
Last admission at 7 PM.

**Do I have to buy tickets online?**  
No, you can also buy tickets when you arrive at our Visitors Center next to the parking lot.

**What are the hours for the Manor and grounds?**  
You can look at the hours: [HERE](https://www.blithewold.org/hours/)

**What if I am part of a reciprocal program, like NARM?  
**You don’t need to purchase tickets online. Check in at the Visitors Center with your reciprocal membership card from your chosen organization ready to show. If you are unsure if your membership is reciprocal we suggest checking with that organization.

**Do you offer SNAP/EBT pricing?**  
Yes we do. You can buy those tickets online or in the Gift Shop. When checking in please have your card ready to show.  
**  
Is this a guided tour?**  
No, it’s a self-guided tour. But you can download an audio tour on your phone for a more guided experience when you a...
collections_text:
## Blithewold Manor • Gardens • Arboretum - An American Garden Treasure

Blithewold is a 33-acre summer estate with grand views of Narragansett Bay and is nationally significant in American history as one of the most fully developed and authentic examples of the Country Place Era. The property features a 45-room mansion filled with family heirlooms, and is framed by a series of lovely gardens that range in character from mysterious to exotic and from poetic to practical. An exceptional collection of rare and unusual plants, specimen trees, an accessible greenhouse, and whimsical stonework project a character that is romantic, fresh, and inspiring – and unique to Blithewold.

Our mission: To curate, interpret, and preserve the cultural heritage of one of New England’s finest garden estates for the enjoyment and education of the public.

Come and experience Blithewold today.

[About the Manor](https://www.blithewold.org/about/the-estate/ "About the Manor") [About the Gardens](https://www.blithewold.org/about/gardens/ "About the Gardens")
